value.name: Royal Academy of Arts
value.snippet: The Royal Academy of Arts, located in the heart of London, is a place where art is made, exhibited and debated.

deepLinks.name: Summer Exhibition Online
deepLinks.snippet: What is the Summer Exhibition? Held without interruption since 1769, the Summer Exhibition displays works in a variety of mediums and genres. The works in the Summer Exhibition are selected and hung by Royal Academicians – who also exhibit works in the exhibition, creating an eclectic mix of work by established artists alongside emerging talent and first-time exhibitors.

value.name: Royal Academy of Arts - Wikipedia
value.snippet: The Royal Academy of Arts (RA) is an art institution based in Burlington House on Piccadilly in London. Founded in 1768, it has a unique position as an independent, privately funded institution led by eminent artists and architects. Its purpose is to promote the creation, enjoyment and appreciation of the visual arts through exhibitions, education and debate.

value.name: Frontpage | Schools of Visual Arts - The Royal Danish Academy of Art
value.snippet: The Schools of Visual Arts, The Royal Danish Academy of Fine Arts is a higher education that provides a framework for teaching, professional development and research in all the visual artistic field. The Schools of Visual Arts performed this task through more than 260 years on the basis of changing perceptions of the role and function of art at ...

value.name: Royal Danish Academy | Architecture, Design, Conservation
value.snippet: The next three academic years the Royal Danish Academy - Architecture, Design, Conservation will focus massively on the UN Global Goals - in our research, in our educations and in our graduation projects. Here you can explore a selection of projects, articles and photos connected to this effort.

value.name: Royal Academy of Arts - Summer Exhibition
value.snippet: If you are successful in the first, digital round, we will notify you by email and ask you to deliver your artwork to the Royal Academy for the next round of selection. You can also check the progress of your submission using your Summer Exhibition account whenever you like.

value.name: Royal Institute of Art
value.snippet: The Royal Institute of Art in Stockholm offers higher education in Fine Art, architecture and critical studies, alongside opportunities for artistic research. To view this site please upgrade or use another browser.

value.name: Royal Academy of Fine Arts Antwerp
value.snippet: The Royal Academy of Fine Arts offers bachelor and master programmes in visual arts, with a variety of specialisations: Painting, Photography, Graphic Design, Jewellery Design, Fashion, Theatre Costume Design, Sculpting, Printmaking and In Situ.

value.name: Books - Royal Academy of Arts -Shop | Royal Academy of Arts
value.snippet: The RA is the home of art and ideas. Explore our selection of books about art and artists. From RA catalogues to Special Editions, art history and theory to titles for young budding artists.

value.name: David Hockney on the Arrival of Spring, Normandy, 2020
value.description: With a new exhibition of joyful spring-time works on show at the RA, David Hockney speaks to curator Edith Devaney from his studio in Normandy. For more information on the exhibition, visit https://www.royalacademy.org.uk/exhibition/david-hockney.

value.name: Watch Picasso Make a Masterpiece
value.description: 'Le Mystère Picasso' is a remarkable documentary film made by French director, Henri-Georges Clouzot, in which stop-action and time-lapse photography are used to capture Picasso at work. Not many of the works he created for the documentary survive – but three hang in the Royal Academy exhibition, 'Picasso and Paper'. Here's how one of them ...

value.name: Milton Avery: American Colourist | Tour
value.description: Milton Avery is considered one of North America’s greatest 20th-century painters. Milton Avery: American Colourist was the first comprehensive exhibition of the artist's work in Europe. It brought together a selection of around 70 of his most celebrated paintings featuring landscapes, portraits, scenes of city life and studies of the human ...

Experience coffee pots turning into cats, typewriters turning into trees, a hunted rhino somersaulting a megaphone ...

value.name: David Hockney: The Arrival of Spring, Normandy, 2020: virtual tour
value.description: If you haven’t been able to visit our David Hockney exhibition in person, here’s your chance to experience it from home. Make a calming cup of tea, press play, and enjoy the arrival of spring through Hockney’s eyes. David Hockney: The Arrival of Spring, Normandy, 2020 is on show at the Royal Academy of Arts 23 May — 26 September 2021 ...

value.name: Salvador Dalí in 60 seconds
value.description: Tim Marlow gives a quick introduction to Salvador Dalí, the Spanish surrealist who became the first art superstar of the television age – and whose surprising friendship with Marcel Duchamp is currently in the spotlight at the RA: https://www.royalacademy.org.uk/exhibition/dali-duchamp FOLLOW US Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/royalacademy ...

value.name: Unboxing Treasures
value.description: Take a look behind the scenes of our new blockbuster exhibition Spain and the Hispanic World. The exhibition features over 150 works exploring Spanish and Latin American art and culture. It's the first time the collection has been shown in the UK. Watch our team unpack and install 18th century treasures as they prepare for the opening of the ...

value.name: Kutluğ Ataman: Summer Exhibition 2016
value.description: Turkish artist and filmmaker Kutluğ Ataman talks about his work 'THE PORTRAIT OF SAKIP SABANCI', which is on show in the Summer Exhibition until 21 August 2016. The work is on loan from the Sakip Sabanci Museum in Istanbul. Find out more about the Summer Exhibition: https://www.royalacademy.org.uk/exhibition/summer-exhibition-2016
